captions.text:
From a production company that sounds like
they make porn

comes a film with the same production value
as a porn.

In the low budget hit that transformed the
horror genre
into straight up torture porn.
Saw.

See Saw, a great idea for a student short
film that somehow got
stretched into 6 feature length sequels,
two videogames,
and one super fun rollercoaster!

When two strangers wake up in your typical
Taco Bell bathroom

the only way out is to patiently use the various
saws,
slabs,

and guns to weaken their chains until they' re
able to break free.

But instead of the obvious, prepare for 100
minutes of
reminiscing,
"I don't remember how I got here."
playing catch,
and dramatically reaching for stuff.
"My family needs me!"
Almost...have another...idea...
Nope!
Tremble before the Jigsaw killer,

a psychopath who combines the traps
of Wile E. Coyote
with the terrifying puppetry of Jeff Dunham.
"Hello, Amanda. I want to play a game."

Come, saw, and conquer the first in a long
line of cheaply made gornos, featuring
the claustrophobia of being trapped in a room

because there wasn't the budget for more
locations,
the panic of the fast-paced editing

because there wasn't the budget for better
effects,

and the cringe-factor of watching the movie' s
screenwriter try to act
"You could be the one who put me in this room!"
"The same thing happened to me, see!"

"Lawrence, calm down! There must be a way
out of this!"

because there wasn't the budget for professional
actors.
So settle in for the one that started it all,
full of cool, well thought out traps

that the sequels turn into complete parodies
of themselves.

"You must press both buttons at once in the
box before you. However, in doing so, you

will give a sacrifice of your own. Two can
live, four will die --"
Ugh, what the f*** is this guy talking about?
And horrific violence happening off-screen

that the sequels turn into the star of 
the franchise.
Who watches this stuff?!
Go to starring, go to starring!
Starring...
Kristen Bell
Robin Hood: Man in Chain
Dental Plan (Lisa Needs Braces)
Awesome Mix, Vol. 1
Rush Hour
This Guy
The Bad Guy From Lost
I Think She's On Parenthood?
Filth
and Cher
Saw 1: You've Saw Them All
Hey, at least it's not a found footage movie!

comments.text:
The first SAW was genuinely a great, tense psychological horror IMO. Making 
most of the violence off-screen was actually very smart, because it made 
the focus be on the characters and their psychological states, not just 
gore. The rest were just utter shite, though.﻿

comments.author: natasha justiniano

comments.text:
This is one of the few exceptions to my critical sensibilities. I ALWAYS 
try to see other people's point of view on EVERY movie, but I can't here. 
Nobody has EVER effectively backed these movies up without resorting to 
calling other people pussies.

I've never said this about anything, but there is no justifiable reason for 
someone liking Saw, its sequels, or any movie that was stupid enough to be 
influenced by it; if someone does like them, they're sadistic fucktards.﻿

comments.author: Derrick Wade

comments.text:
Am I the only girl to watch the entire saw franchise? (>..>) (<...<) (>...< 
) If so then I must be a very special person o.o. Saw isn't meant to be 
scary it's really meant to keep you guessing on who's gonna die or not XD 
then at the end they tie the show off by linking it to another film so all 
the plots peaces fit nicely o.o that's what I enjoyed from the series was 
how everything fit together to reveal a bigger picture.

Now... I have seen every gory film under the sun soooo it doesn't really 
affect me o.o I enjoyed the traps too XD In my opinion it's the best serial 
killer film out there. Other than dexter the series but I felt that dexter 
wasn't as demented and honestly I enjoy the darker more twisted murderer 
who's also creative XD

It's better than hostle too o..o if anyone has seen that movie they will 
know right away o..o that it's not as creative as saw and people torturing 
people to death in an underground club o..o well it's just not that 
convincing XD You don't need a club for that. I felt like I was watching 
deadman wonderland in a sense only without collars of poison or the dead 
man fights and the wheel of torture... Oh wait they did have a wheel of 
torture XD In a sense. o...o But I digress saw to me is the most demented 
and twisted you can get. Because they are all given a chance to live and 
escape but if they fail they die and it's basically their fault for not 
obeying the psycho's rules XD

Meh it was super enjoyable how everything fits together all you gotta get 
past is the gore and the gross stuff. If you have a strong stomach like me 
( Iron stomach ) Then by the end you will be like " NEVER SAW THAT COMING! 
" No pun intended XD the sad thing though o..o Is to see all the 
connections you need to watch all seven movies within a few nights XD like 
watch a marathon then you are like NO WAY IT FITS TOGETHER! XP I enjoy that 
it does have a plot. >o> it's not just traps and gore. But the first one 
really wasn't all that great it got better as it went XD﻿
